action.action-desc: Mr. Ossoff (for himself and Mr. Tillis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to develop requirements for military tenant advocates for privatized military housing, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Tenant Advocacy Improvement Act.

section.header: Requirements for military tenant advocates for privatized military housing

subsection.text: Subchapter V of chapter 169 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 2890 the following new section:

The Secretary of Defense shall ensure that each installation of the Department of Defense at which military housing under subchapter IV of this chapter is offered has a military tenant advocate employed by the military department concerned.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall implement a uniform training and certification program for all individuals serving or selected to serve as a military tenant advocate under subsection (a).
The training and certification program under paragraph (1) shall include, at a minimum, instruction on the following:

subparagraph.text: The authority of the Secretary to provide military housing under subchapter IV of this chapter.
The role, authority, and responsibility of housing management offices.
The Military Housing Privatization Initiative Tenant Bill of Rights developed under section 2890 of this title.
The dispute resolution process under section 2894 of this title.

The resources available to tenants of military housing under subchapter IV of this chapter to ensure that all such tenants are living in housing that meets the standards described in the Military Housing Privatization Initiative Tenant Bill of Rights.
Relevant national, State, and local housing, disability, and environmental laws.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall conduct public outreach and education at each installation of the Department with a military tenant advocate under subsection (a) to provide members of the armed forces and their families with information on the identity, role, and authority of the military tenant advocate.

When hiring or selecting individuals to serve in the role of military tenant advocate under subsection (a), no preferential consideration shall be given to individuals currently or previously employed by—

paragraph.text: a housing provider or manager owning or operating military housing under subchapter IV of this chapter.
The table of sections at the beginning of such subchapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 2890 the following new item:

subparagraph.text: Section 2890(b) of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

clause.text: in paragraph (5), by inserting under section 2890a of this title after advocate; and
in paragraph (8), by striking , as provided in section 2894(b)(4) of this title, and inserting under section 2890a of this title.

subparagraph.text: Section 2894(b)(4) of such title is amended by striking military housing advocate employed by the military department concerned and inserting military tenant advocate under section 2890a of this title.
